AUPH I find it confusing that people solely blame auph management for the price action They have made this a much more fundamentally sound company from where it was when all they had was a single indication midstage company They have made great strides to increase shareholder value For those that dont have a lot of clinical stage investing experience the market quite often doesnt react the way it shouldand the past 1218 months have been a prime example of thatWe should see a really nice runup this fall heading into PH3 readout Summers often get very slow as bigsmart takes time offbut I wouldnt dare be caught on the sidelines and miss a surprise announcement Im much more excited about the potential here now then I was at the PH2B readout Dont be one of those impatient investors that will have significant regret not waiting this out

AUPH The new CEO Peter Greenleaf there less than a month please give him a chance He said today at Jefferies conf that details for DES dev would be disclosed in the next month or two probably at the time of the next earnings last year 2nd quarter was released July 30th He already stated that the next trial Phase 23 would be underway before the end of the year Because this has BB potential they obviously want to make sure they get it right first time design patients primary secondary endpoints that its powered correctly to demonstrate statistical significance etc If the results are ve for the next trial know in 2020 I expect them to need to do one more trial pivotal Phase 3 trial prior to submitting the NDA for FDA approval likely in 2021 However I think that if the Phase 23 trial results are positive which is clearly what we would expect given the incredible results weve just seen market doesnt get it AUPH likely BO in 2020 Bullish

AUPH Depends on Phase 3 AURORA resultsYes is does Look again at Phase 2 AURA data best ever by a long shot for an LN trial including Cellcept MMF which actually failed Phase 3 trials for LN but became the standard of care for LN anyway because it was so much better than anything else IMHO voclosporin is far superior than potential non oral drug Benlysta from GSK also being developed for LN So VERY BullishEXTREMELY

AUPH Can someone please help me understand the DES program and the delay in a phase 23 study Every conference they speak so highly of the secondary efficacy especially when you are comparing it to the current level of care Restasis Xidra Cequa etc we blew them all away I know we assume LN is going to go well but if it doesnt go as planned wouldnt you want a billion dollar a year drug ready to go in the pipeline to keep your value where it is at It took Auph 4 weeks to prove its dominance on the current standard of care Would it be that difficult to get this program started ASAP I would feel much more at ease with at least a little head wind going into Q4 Maybe Iljin wants the same thing Any input would be nice
